Package LList

Class Account

  • java.lang.Object
    • LList.Account
  • public class Account
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to create an account object

    • Constructor Summary

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void block​(Account account)
      If the user is logged in, then the account is blocked, and if the user is following or is followed by the account, then the following and follower relationships are removed
      boolean checkAnyLogin​(java.util.LinkedList<Account> accounts)
      This function checks if any account is logged in
      void checkInbox()
      It checks the inbox of the user and prints out the messages
      boolean checkIsFollower​(Account account)
      This function checks if the account passed in is a follower of the account that called the function
      boolean checkIsFollowing​(Account account)
      This function checks if the account is following the account passed in as a parameter
      void checkOutbox()
      It prints out all the messages in the outbox
      void comment​(int postID, Account account, java.lang.String content)
      This function is used to add a comment to a post
      void follow​(Account account)
      If the user is logged in and the account is not blocked, then the user follows the account and the account's followers are updated

      This function returns the accountID of the account

      This function logs out the current account

      If the user is logged in, and the account is not blocked, and the user is following the account, then the user can send a message to the account

      This function adds or removes a message from the outbox

      This function is used to add or remove a post from the posts array

      This function sets the username to the value of the newUsername parameter.
      void sharePost​(Post post)
      If the user is logged in, then share the post, otherwise, print a message
      void showHistory()
      The function shows the user's history of actions if they are logged in, otherwise it prompts them to log in first.
      void unblock​(Account account)
      This function unblocks a specified account if the user is logged in and adds a corresponding action to the user's history.
      void uncomment​(int postID, Account account, int interactionID)
      The function allows an account to remove their own comment from a post.
      void unfollow​(Account account)
      This function allows a user to unfollow another account if they are not blocked and are currently logged in.
      void unlike​(int postID, Account account)
      The function allows an account to unlike a post by removing their like from the post's list of likes.
      void viewInteractions​(Account account, java.util.LinkedList<Account> accounts)
      This function prints out the posts of the account passed in as a parameter, and prints out the likes and comments of each post
      void viewPosts​(Account account)
      It prints out all the posts of the account that is passed in as a parameter
      void viewProfile​(Account account)
      It prints out the profile of the account that is passed as a parameter

        It prints out all the posts of the account that is passed in as a parameter
        Parameters:
        account - The account whose posts are to be viewed.

      • viewInteractions

        public void viewInteractions​(Account account,
                             java.util.LinkedList<Account> accounts)
        This function prints out the posts of the account passed in as a parameter, and prints out the likes and comments of each post
        Parameters:
        account - The account whose posts are to be viewed.
        accounts - an array of all the accounts in the system

        public void sharePost​(Post post)

        Parameters:
        post - The post you want to share.

      • follow

        public void follow​(Account account)
        If the user is logged in and the account is not blocked, then the user follows the account and the account's followers are updated
        Parameters:
        account - The account that you want to follow.

        public void like​(int postID,
                 Account account)
        This function is used to like a post
        Parameters:
        postID - The ID of the post that you want to like.
        account - The account that is being liked.

                    Account account,
                    java.lang.String content)
        This function is used to add a comment to a post
        Parameters:
        postID - The ID of the post you want to comment on.
        account - The account that the post is on.
        content - The content of the comment

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage​(java.lang.String content,
                        Account account)
        If the user is logged in, and the account is not blocked, and the user is following the account, then the user can send a message to the account
        Parameters:
        content - The content of the message.
        account - The account that you want to send message to.

      • block

        public void block​(Account account)
        If the user is logged in, then the account is blocked, and if the user is following or is followed by the account, then the following and follower relationships are removed
        Parameters:
        account - The account that you want to block.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        A boolean value.

        public boolean checkIsFollower​(Account account)
        This function checks if the account passed in is a follower of the account that called the function
        Parameters:
        account - The account that you want to check if it's a follower of the current account.
        Returns:
        A boolean value.

      • isBlocked

        public boolean isBlocked​(Account account)
        If the account is blocked, return true, otherwise return false.
        Parameters:
        account - The account that is trying to access the account.
        Returns:
        A boolean value.

      • checkAnyLogin

        public boolean checkAnyLogin​(java.util.LinkedList<Account> accounts)
        This function checks if any account is logged in
        Parameters:
        accounts - An array of Account objects.
        Returns:
        A boolean value.

      • unlike

        public void unlike​(int postID,
                   Account account)
        The function allows an account to unlike a post by removing their like from the post's list of likes.
        Parameters:
        postID - The ID of the post that the user wants to unlike.
        account - The "account" parameter is an object of the "Account" class, which represents the user account that is performing the "unlike" action.

      • uncomment

        public void uncomment​(int postID,
                      Account account,
                      int interactionID)
        The function allows an account to remove their own comment from a post.
        Parameters:
        postID - The ID of the post that the comment belongs to.
        account - An object of the class Account representing the account of the user who wants to uncomment a comment on a post.
        interactionID - The interaction ID is a unique identifier for a specific interaction (such as a comment or like) on a post. It is used to identify which interaction is being referred to in the uncomment method.

      • unblock

        public void unblock​(Account account)
        This function unblocks a specified account if the user is logged in and adds a corresponding action to the user's history.
        Parameters:
        account - The "account" parameter is an object of the "Account" class, which represents a user account in a system. It is used as an input to the "unblock" method to unblock the specified account.

      • unfollow

        public void unfollow​(Account account)
        This function allows a user to unfollow another account if they are not blocked and are currently logged in.
        Parameters:
        account - The "account" parameter is an object of the "Account" class, which represents the user account that the current user wants to unfollow.

      • showHistory

        public void showHistory()
        The function shows the user's history of actions if they are logged in, otherwise it prompts them to log in first.
